Learn why AI-driven development with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud is key, and how the planned harmonization will make it easier to build extensions and support the clean core. Furthermore, learn about opportunities for partners to extend SAP solutions.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP), Khaled Musilhy (SAP), tbd

🗺️ Roadmap Sessions (25 minutes)

AD808 – SAP Build: ABAP Cloud road map
See our upcoming innovations for the ABAP Cloud development model including Joule and the Business Data Cloud integration in context and get updates on the roadmap ahead.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP)

DT814 – Extensibility innovations road map for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
Explore upcoming extensibility innovations for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP. Discover road maps for suite extensibility, harmonization, and partner enablement for commercial use cases. Learn more about upcoming innovations for AI-driven extensibility with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud to support your clean core strategy.
Speakers: Oren Shatil (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), External Speaker

🔍Deep Dives (45 minutes)

AD104 – Boost your  ABAP development with Joule for developers  | also available virtually as AD104v
In this deep dive session you will learn all aspects of the ABAP AI strategy, from accelerating your ABAP development, over developing custom AI scenarios, up to using Joule to transform your ABAP code.
Speakers: Simona Marincei (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP)

AD105 – Introduction to ABAP Cloud and how to get started 
ABAP Cloud is the new way of developing ABAP—fully cloud-enabled and driven by AI. It combines cloud technologies with a clear separation of SAP and custom code, and in this way revolutionizes ABAP development. Grasp the major concepts of ABAP Cloud and learn how you can upskill. Also learn about Bosch Digital’s journey to ABAP Cloud and clean core.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), External Speaker

AD201 – Explore ABAP Cloud in SAP Build - what's in for ABAP developers?   
In this deep dive we will highlight the importance of our strategic approach of integrating ABAP Cloud in SAP Build. Learn how you can benefit from this for Fiori App development and how the graphical modeler helps you to create ABAP CDS models conveniently. Finally, get insights into the future direction.
Speakers: Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

DT200 – Unravel the mysteries of Clean Core extensions in Cloud ERP Private 
Learn about the new, enhanced clean core extensibility concept in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. Learn about tools like ABAP Test Cockpit and RISE Dashboard, as well as guidance and best practices that help you to measure, govern, re-factor and develop your custom extensions in a clean core compliant, upgrade stable and cloud-ready way.
Speakers: Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT201 – Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP
Learn about the on-stack key user and developer tools in the ABAP Cloud development model, now enhanced with generative AI. See how you can extend standard SAP applications and manage your custom apps directly in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Get insights into latest innovations for transactional, analytical, and integration use cases, such as the extensibility AI Assistant, editable tree-views, custom queries for analytical SAP Fiori apps, ABAP SQL services and more.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Oren Shatil (SAP)

🛠️ Hands-On Workshops (2 hours)

AD162 – Explore Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities    
Learn how to develop a RAP business object while exploring Joule's ABAP AI capabilities
Speakers: Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Simona Marincei (SAP)

AD163 – Fusion Development with ABAP Cloud in SAP Build
In this session we will practice fusion development of ABAP Cloud in SAP Build by creating an ABAP Cloud project from the SAP Build lobby to develop a RAP BO including a Fiori application on top.
Speakers: Ingo Braüninger (SAP), Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

AD164 – Get started with ABAP Cloud for classic ABAP developers    
Familiar with classic ABAP development? Join us to learn how similar development works with ABAP Cloud development model using the ABAP RESTful application programming model (RAP). ABAP Cloud is the comprehensive model for building cloud-ready business apps, services, and extensions that follow clean core principles by default – on SAP BTP and SAP S/4HANA, both in the cloud and on-premise.
Speakers: Volker Drees (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), Jürgen Reidl (SAP)

DT260 – Modernize classic extensions to clean core in Cloud ERP Private    
In this session you will practice a clean core extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. You will learn how to govern clean core development using the ABAP Test Cockpit, and how to use ABAP Cloud and clean core extensibility principles to modernize your custom on-stack extensions.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT261 – Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in Cloud ERP Public
Join us to discover how to build extensions, applications, and services with the ABAP Cloud development model, using the ABAP RESTful application programming model and generative AI. You will learn how to extend standard SAP applications, consume public SAP APIs, and build new apps and services from scratch. Get practical insights through exercises and take the opportunity to ask your questions.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Volker Drees (SAP), Steffen Mattes (SAP)

DT266 – Troubleshoot and Optimize ABAP Cloud Extensions in Cloud ERP 
Ensuring optimal performance and stability of your ABAP Cloud-based extensions is crucial to long-term success. Learn advanced techniques and best practices for troubleshooting and optimizing custom code in the Cloud ERP. Use powerful tools like ABAP Cross Trace to get deep insights into execution flows and resource consumption.
Speakers: Steffen Mattes (SAP), Juergen Reidl (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP)

👋Join Us

I hope this overview gives you even more reasons to join us at one of the SAP TechEd 2025 tour stops in Berlin (DE), Louisville (US), Sydney (AU), Bangalore (IN), Birmingham (UK), or Hamburg (DE) – or attend online, free of charge!

We look forward to meeting and interacting with you! 🤝  In the meantime, you can watch the replays of last year's events: ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd Virtual 2024 and ABAP Cloud at SAP's Devtoberfest in 2024. You can also have a look at the 🔥ABAP Cloud sessions at the upcoming Devtoberfest 2025, running online and free of charge from September 29 to October 24, 2025! 🤝

Stay tuned – and see you there!

entry.title: ABAP Cloud Sessions at Devtoberfest 2025
entry.content:
Get ready – Devtoberfest 2025 from SAP  is almost here! 🎉

The annual celebration of SAP technologies kicks off soon, bringing weeks of learning, community, and fun – all completely free and fully virtual. Following content tracks are available this year‌: 🟢 Monday – ABAP | 🟣 Tuesday – Tooling & Frontend | 🔴 Wednesday – Integration |  🔵 Thursday – Data & AI | 🟠 Friday – CAP | 🟡 All Week – Fun Activities. Check out the blog post  Devtoberfest 2025 Welcome! by Thomas Jung to learn more about the event.

Key event Info:
  📅 Dates: September 29 – October 24, 2025
  📺 Where: All sessions livestreamed or premiered on the SAP Developers YouTube channel 
  🔁 Tradition continues: Every Monday during Devtoberfest is ABAP Day 💚!
  📚 Session Catalog: Explore the full session line-up in the SAP Community events area: Devtoberfest

 

Check out the compact overview of ABAP Cloud sessions at Devtoberfest 2025 below. Session details are provided in the next section. Expect plenty demos and opportunities to interact with fellow developers and SAP experts!

📅[CW 40] WEEK 1 – 🟢29th September 2025

  • Clean Core Extensibility Strategy powered by ABAP Cloud and Generative AI 
  • Custom code development and transformation for Clean Core in SAP S/4HANA
  • Boost your developer satisfaction and productivity with SAP Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities
📅 [CW 41] WEEK 2 – 🟢6th October 2025
  • News on SAP BTP ABAP environment
  • Explore the latest updates in ABAP CDS
  • Updates on Embedded Analytics in ABAP Cloud
📅[CW 42] WEEK 3 – 🟢13th October 2025
  • What's new in the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP)
  • Evolving data integration with SQL services and CDS external entities
  • Discover the latest innovations in the ABAP language 
📅[CW 43] WEEK 4 – 🟢20th October 2025
  • Exploring the path to SAP certification‌
  • 🚧 Stay tuned – additional sessions coming soon! 

Session Details

Week 1

🟢 Clean Core Extensibility Strategy powered by ABAP Cloud and Generative AI 
In this session we’ll explain how the new clean core approach makes systems ready for the future, how AI-powered capabilities can enhance development and transformation processes, and give an update on the latest ABAP Cloud innovations.
Speakers: Fabian Fellhauer (SAP)
Schedule: 29th September 2025, 9:30 am - 10:30 am CEST

🟢 Custom code development and transformation for Clean Core in SAP S/4HANA
In this session you will learn the enhanced guidelines for ABAP custom code development and governance for clean core supported by the new ABAP Test Cockpit checks. In addition, we provide the overview about the new Gen AI assistance in custom code management tools.
Speakers:  Olga Dolinskaja (SAP),  Thomas Fiedler (SAP) 
Schedule:  29th September 2025, 1:00 pm - 2:00 pm CEST

🟢 Boost your developer satisfaction and productivity with SAP Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabiliti...
In what ways can AI support ABAP developers in their day-to-day activities? Find out more on the supported use cases, the generative AI road map, and insights on SAP Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities.
Speakers: Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Jasmin Gruschke (SAP)
Schedule: 29th September 2025, 4:00pm - 5:00pm CEST

Week 2

🟢 News on SAP BTP ABAP environment
SAP BTP ABAP Environment is the platform as a service for ABAP developers. It’s a cloud-optimized ABAP platform based on SAP HANA Cloud that serves as a development and runtime environment for cloud apps. This session gives you an update about the latest product news and explains with live demos how to use the Technical Monitoring Cockpit, and how to use the different tools for supportability and performance measurement. 
Speakers: Frank Jentsch (SAP)
Schedule: 6th October 2025, 9:30 am - 10:30 am CEST

🟢 Explore the latest updates in ABAP CDS
As one of the fundamental technologies of ABAP Cloud, ABAP CDS continues to advance. This session will present the latest developments in ABAP CDS including CDS table entities, CDS Explain functionality, analytical query modelling features and, CDS aspects. 
Speakers: Santiago Zuniga Garcia (SAP), Boyan Boychev (SAP)
Schedule: 6th October 2025, 1:00 pm - 2:00 pm CEST

🟢 Updates on Embedded Analytics in ABAP Cloud
ABAP Core Data Services (CDS) based embedded analytics provides easy-to-use analytical tooling and allows you to drill down, aggregate, and display data from your core solution modeled with ABAP CDS.  
In this session, we present the latest additions to embedded analytics in ABAP Cloud. You will experience the new review booklet app generator for building native, SAP Fiori apps on top of an analytical service exposure and will get to know the analytical modeling examples on GitHub that act as showcases for the latest features of CDS-based analytical queries.
Speakers: Andreas Riehl (SAP)
Schedule: 6th October 2025, 4:00pm - 5:00pm CEST

Week 3

🟢 What's new in the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP)
ABAP Cloud is the powerful development model for building cloud applications on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) and SAP S/4HANA, in the cloud and on premise. Experience live demos of the major ABAP Cloud capabilities around the ABAP RESTful application programming model which can be used to build and extend transactional and analytical applications
Speakers: Andre Fischer (SAP) 
Schedule: 13th October 2025, 9:30 am - 10:30 am CEST

🟢 Evolving data integration with SQL services and CDS external entities
In this session, we’ll present the latest advancements in ABAP Cloud data integration. On the data exposure side, we’ll cover ABAP-managed database procedures for advanced read scenarios and extensions of SQL services to enable data loading scenarios for SQL clients, using CDS writable view entities. On the consumption side, we’ll explore write scenarios, and the use of static CDS external entities for seamless integration of external data into aCDS view stack. 
Speakers: Leon Stern (SAP), Yannick Rath (SAP)
Schedule: 13th October 2025, 1:00 pm - 2:00 pm CEST

🟢 Discover the latest innovations in the ABAP language 
In this session, we 'll provide an overview of the latest features introduced to the ABAP language. Highlights include support for spatial data in ABAP SQL, enhanced JSON and Geo-JSON processing capabilities, Buffer Delegation in ABAP SQL, and new functionalities for probability distributions and advanced random number generation. We'll also share insights into the ABAP language roadmap. 
Speakers:  Kilian Kilger (SAP), Stefan Bresch (SAP), Gerd Forstmann (SAP)
Schedule: 13th October 2025, 4:00pm - 5:00pm CEST

Week 4

🟢 Exploring the path to SAP certification
This session will offer developers insights around navigating SAP learning offerings and the certification programs based on my own ABAP journey. Attendees will learn the most important steps toward SAP certifications, understand the differences between certification types (associate, specialist, professional), and how to choose the ideal certification based on your role and skill-set. We’ll also review preparation strategies, tips, and tricks to help you along your way. 
Speakers:  Sandra Solis (SAP Champion, external)
Schedule: 20th October 2025, 1:00 pm - 2:00 pm CEST

🚧Stay tuned – additional sessions coming soon!

Curious to learn more? Join the sessions to explore the latest ABAP innovations and best practices firsthand.

In the meantime, catch up on last year’s highlights with the replays from SAP's Devtoberfest 2024 and SAP TechEd Virtual 2024. You can also have a look at the ABAP Cloud sessions at the upcoming SAP TechEd in 2025, starting November 4–6, 2025 on-site in Berlin and Louisville (ASUG Tech Connect) –  and online for free! 🎉

We can’t wait to connect with you – stay tuned! 🍻

entry.title: “Business Excellence with SAP’s New Clean Core Extensibility Levels: Why, What and How”
entry.content:
1. Introduction:

SAP provides pre-delivered content to run your business. A Clean Core approach means keeping Cloud ERP systems up-to-date, free from unnecessary customizations, and aligned with industry best practices. This gives the benefits of driving innovation-readiness, ensuring seamless future upgrades and reducing technical debt.

1.1 Key guiding principles of a Clean Core

There are five essential guiding principles that contribute to an efficient and sustainable Cloud ERP system:

  1. Processes – Streamlining end-to-end (E2E) business workflows for efficiency.
  2. Integration – Ensuring seamless communication between extensions and core enterprise solutions.
  3. Extensibility – Extending standard software functionality to meet unique organizational needs.
  4. Data – Managing configuration, master, and transactional data effectively.
  5. Operations – Managing infrastructure, upgrades, system monitoring, and maintenance.

In this article, we will focus on the “Extensibility” guiding principle.

To support business differentiation while maintaining a Clean Core, organizations can adopt various extensibility models.  A clean core strategy doesn't mean to exclude extensibility entirely, the crucial part is understanding the appropriate way to implement the extensions.  You can create extensions using SAP Build via “Side-by-side” extensibility (loosely coupled) on BTP (including AI-enhanced pro-code and low-code tools) or through “S/4 HANA On-stack” extensibility (tightly coupled).

2. WHY New Clean Core Extensibility Levels:

SAP has refined its clean core model, evolving from the former three-tier structure to a more detailed four-level concept (A, B, C, and D). Instead of a simple “clean vs. not clean” classification. These levels show how closely your custom extensions align with clean core principles.

This evolution provides greater clarity for extension decisions and simplifies qualification criteria, giving organizations a more practical way to balance innovation with long-term sustainability. It’s about making smarter, future-proof extensibility choices while ensuring business differentiation doesn’t come at the cost of technical debt.

Here’s what it means in practice:

  1. Smarter, future-proof choices – Enable meaningful business differentiation without slowing down with legacy overhead.
  2. Clean, scalable extensions – Build on SAP BTP, ABAP Cloud, and SAP Build—all supported by Joule, SAP’s AI copilot.
  3. Progress you can measure – Monitor and track clean core adoption with tools like the RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard and ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC). The dashboards will be updated and reflect the new levels.

3. WHAT are the new clean core extensibility Levels:

Before exploring the new clean core extensibility levels are, it is important to understand what an API is—because most of these levels are closely tied to APIs.

  • An API (Application Programming Interface) is essentially a defined set of rules, protocols, and interfaces that allows one software application to communicate with another.
  • In simple terms, an API acts like a bridge. It lets developers access specific functions, data, or services of a system without needing to dive into, or modify, the underlying code.

There are four extensibility levels from the cleanest form of extensions to not clean extensions.

Level A – The cleanest form of custom extensions. These are built either directly on-stack with the ABAP Cloud development model or side-by-side on SAP BTP using SAP Build, whether through ABAP Cloud, CAP, or low-code/no-code tools. Represents highest standard in SAP extensibility, offering future-ready solutions with maximum upgrade stability by utilizing released API’s and extension points.

Level B –Extensions that follow SAP’s best practices for classic ABAP development and use only officially provided SAP APIs and frameworks. These extensions can be used only if the requirements cannot be fulfilled by set of released APIs (Level A). These include wide range of legacy APIs, user exits, BadIs and established frameworks like SAP GUI and ABAP list viewer grid.

Level C – Extensions at Level C involve the use of SAP internal objects that are not classified or intended for customer use. These objects are neither officially released, recommended, nor cloud-ready, and they fall outside SAP’s formal support scope. However, with the introduction of the new changelog for SAP objects (currently in work and will become later available), customers can proactively analyze and plan for potential upgrade impacts when Level C objects are affected by incompatible changes. For this reason, Level C extensions are considered conditionally clean.

Level D – Classified as not clean core. This level includes extensions that don’t follow SAP’s guidelines, such as system modifications, reliance on non-recommended SAP objects, or unsupported techniques like implicit enhancements.

Below table explains the differences in each level for comparison.

For detailed guidance on frameworks, technologies and development patterns in the context of clean core extensibility, please refer to SAP Note: 3578329.

4. HOW to find SAP extensibility objects classification by levels:

The “SAP Business Accelerator Hub” and “Cloudification Repository (API Viewer)” are the central tools to classify objects by clean core level. It shows which objects are:

  • Released APIs (Level A)
  • Classic APIs (Level B)
  • No APIs (Level D)
  • Internal Objects (Level C – default when not classified as A, B and D)

The SAP API Business Hub is SAP’s central catalog of APIs, integration content, and business services. All the APIs are classified as Level A. Remote APIs are for consumption in BTP and local APIs are for consumption in “On-stack extensibility”.

The Cloudification Repository Viewer is an interactive tool designed to help developers explore API details for “SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public” and “SAP S/4HANA Private Edition” for on-stack extensions.

Links:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition (Doesn’t include Classic APIs)
  • SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition (Classic API’s)

In this article, I will be demonstrating the usage of “S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition”.

4.1 Extension Level A

The cleanest form of custom extensions. These are built either directly on-stack with the ABAP Cloud development model or side-by-side on SAP BTP using SAP Build, whether through ABAP Cloud, CAP, or low-code/no-code tools. You can find the released API’s at SAP Business Accelerator Hub. If you are a developer, you can find the released API’s directly in the IDE (Integrated Development Environment).

 Alternatively, for “SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition" you can follow the below steps.

Detailed Steps:

1. Go to S/4 HANA Cloud ERP Private  (Doesn’t include Classic APIs)
2. Click “Show Filter Bar”

3. Choose “Released” under State drop down.

4. You have different options to filter results based on “Object type”, “Software Component” and “Application Component”

5. You can also search for objects (Example of search results for “purchase_order”)

4.2 Extension Level B – Classics APIs:

Extensions that follow SAP’s best practices for classic ABAP development and use only officially provided SAP APIs and frameworks. These extensions can be used only if the requirements cannot be fulfilled by set of released APIs (Level A). These include wide range of legacy APIs, user exits, BadIs and established frameworks like SAP GUI and ABAP list viewer grid.

Detailed Steps on finding the Classic API’s:

  1. Go to S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition (Classic API’s)
  2. Click “Show Filter Bar”

3. Choose “Classic API” in the state 

4. You can choose filter criteria as needed

5. You can also search for objects (Example of search results for “sales”)

4.3 Extension Level C – Conditionally Clean

Extensions at Level C involve the use of SAP internal objects that are not classified or intended for customer use. These objects are neither officially released, recommended, nor cloud-ready, and they fall outside SAP’s formal support scope. However, with the introduction of the new changelog for SAP objects (currently in work and will become later available), customers can proactively analyze and plan for potential upgrade impacts when Level C objects are affected by incompatible changes. For this reason, Level C extensions are considered conditionally clean.

  • You can find objects in Level A (Released APIs), Level B (Classical APIs) and Level D (No APIs).

Level C refers to all internal SAP objects that are neither “Released APIs,” “Classical APIs,” nor “APIs” at all. Since they are internal objects, no official list exists.

4.4 Extension Level D – Not Clean Core

Extensions at level D are classified as not clean core. These includes extensions that doesn’t follow SAP’s guidelines, such as system modifications, reliance on non-recommended SAP objects, or unsupported techniques like implicit enhancements.

Detailed Steps on finding objects which are “Not APIs” classified as “No APIs”

  1. Go to S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition (Classic API’s)
  2. Click “Show Filter Bar

3. Choose “No API” in State

4. Results with “No APIs” are displayed

5. Successor information is available for some of the objects.

5. Summary:
With this evolved model, SAP is giving organizations a smarter playbook for extension decisions. By aligning with clean core principles on a clear scale (Levels A, B, C and D), businesses can innovate faster, keep their systems future-ready, and reduce technical debt—while still getting the flexibility they need today.

entry.title: Never ever remove an IAM app from a Business Catalog
entry.content:
Never ever remove an IAM app from a Business Catalog!!!

As soon as such a Business Catalog change is published, as per SAP, "all roles need to be processed to ensure consistency since the data does not have a link anymore between the removed IAM apps and the affected catalogs."

Yes, it processes all roles in the system

In our case, it was 6000 roles in the system. As you can see, the publishing/unpublishing jobs have been running for 7 days now and still continuing. We have been in touch with SAP Support. Their explanation of how publishing works: "In general, it works like this: if a publishing process A is triggered, it is processed right away. If during this process new publishing processes B and C are triggered, this is added to a queue until the publishing process A from before is done. Then B and C will be processed together. Now, if there are 10 or 20 of them queued up, they all will be processed together and depending on the objects, this can take longer. "

There were 30-40 processes running in the system at the beginning. Now after 7 days, it has reduced to 11 processes. It locked up all the business roles for changes during the publishing process - Security team can't make any updates to roles for several days. Developers couldn't create new apps/communication scenarios/services etc. in the system. 

So, what is the workaround for this if someone really wants to remove an IAM app from a Business Catalog? The only way I could think of, is to create a brand-new Business Catalog and move whatever apps that are really needed into the new one. But, what if few months down the line, someone wants to remove another app from that 2nd Business Catalog? ... and so on...

Does this mean, to avoid all this trouble, developers should be allowed to have only one IAM app per Business Catalog? Are there any other possible ideas?
